definition: unalterable/certainly/definitely
iron (metal)/arms/weapons/hard/strong/violent/unshakeable/determined/close/tight (slang)
surname Tie
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: February was definitely not a good month for the automobile industry in America.
sentences.chinese: 二月份鐵定是美國汽車工業銷售慘淡的一個月。

sentences.english: LeBron James is a lock to start his fifth consecutive All-Star team.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯是鐵定開始他連續第五次全明星首發陣容的。

sentences.english: Japan's economy seems doomed to fall back into recession.
sentences.chinese: 日本經濟看來也鐵定要跌回到不景氣。

sentences.english: My mom is dead set on me going to graduate school, I guess Imust go.
sentences.chinese: 我是鐵定了心要我上研究生，我猜我必需的去了。

sentences.english: Such a person's results must be eliminated.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的人的結果鐵定是被淘汰。

sentences.english: The United States will keep its "ironclad" commitment to allies in the region, he added.
sentences.chinese: 美國將繼續對該地區的盟友保持“鐵定的”承諾。

sentences.english: China’s economy certainly can not depend on exports over the next year.
sentences.chinese: 中國經濟鐵定不能指望靠出口過個好年。

definition: to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
at the minimum/at the very least
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
sooner or later
it is said that/reportedly
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
to bear fruit/CL:個|个[ge4]
ought to/should/must
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
can't say for sure/maybe
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
not necessarily/not likely
lit. to pour cold water on/fig. to dampen one's enthusiasm
the end/to conclude
to leave (the stage, an exam room, the playing field etc)/to take part in some activity/to take an examination (in the imperial examination system)
